relevantProvisions.title: Total Small Business Set-Asides
relevantProvisions.applicationToScenario: This provision applies as the procurement value is between the micro-purchase and simplified acquisition thresholds, requiring a set-aside for small businesses. With five small businesses capable of providing the equipment, this ensures compliance with small business utilization.

relevantProvisions.title: Sustainable Acquisition Policy
relevantProvisions.applicationToScenario: The agency's sustainability initiative aligns with this provision, requiring that 95% of new contract actions include energy-efficient products. The purchase of ENERGY STAR certified computers and printers complies with this requirement.

relevantProvisions.title: Effect of Listing
relevantProvisions.applicationToScenario: This provision prohibits awarding contracts to debarred or proposed debarment contractors. Two potential suppliers are on the debarment list, so they must be excluded from consideration unless a compelling reason is documented.

complianceIssues.issueDescription: Lack of formal supplier qualification process.
complianceIssues.correctiveAction: Implement a documented supplier qualification process to ensure all suppliers meet quality standards. This includes verifying certifications and checking against exclusion lists to comply with FDA purchasing controls.

Establish written documentation for quality requirements communicated to suppliers. This ensures compliance with document control regulations and prevents misunderstandings that could lead to non-compliant products.

complianceIssues.issueDescription: Undisclosed conflict of interest in supplier relationship.
complianceIssues.correctiveAction: Develop a conflict of interest policy requiring disclosure of personal relationships with suppliers. This will prevent potential bias in supplier selection and ensure compliance with anti-kickback regulations.

scenarioDecisions.correctAction: Do not proceed with the supplier until their certification is verified in the industry database. Ensure compliance with supplier qualification regulations by requiring updated and verifiable certification documentation.

Require detailed supply chain documentation to verify conflict-free sourcing. This ensures compliance with SEC reporting requirements for conflict minerals and avoids potential legal and reputational risks.
Request updated SDS in the GHS format before purchasing. Ensure compliance with hazardous materials regulations by verifying that all documentation is current and meets regulatory standards.

Consider the qualified small business to meet subcontracting goals. This aligns with federal contract requirements for small business utilization and supports compliance with subcontracting regulations.
